page.title: 17Whitsun Walk
page.content: {WHITSUN WALK } The Noncornformist Chapels' annual 'walk' first took place in July 1853. Each Whitsun since then the children of the Sunday schools have joined with the adults to march in procession through the main streets of the area to demonstrate their strength and faith.In fair weather it is customary for a large silken banner to be carried ahead of the congregation.Each banner is inscribed with the name of the Sunday School and underneath is a religious picture and a text.The minister and elders walk behind the banner followed by the choir singing well practised special hymns;then the children walk two by two with their teachers.Afterwards there is a teaparty and perhaps games. Sadly the custom has become less popular. { }
